commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Duke file to Kermit
Add helper function to format text
Add echo function to Kermit Bot
Fix grammar error in intro text
Change echo to add text
Change access modifier of formatText() to private
commitResults.messageBody:
formatText is used to format Kermit's speech and should not be used outside the class

Change formatText() method access modifier to private

formatText being private hides the implementation details from users

commitResults.messageTitle: Add list command to Kermit
commitResults.messageBody: Typing to text (with the exception of "bye" and "list") would add the text to a list. The list command would print all the items is in the list

commitResults.messageTitle: Move list logic to ToDo class
Add class to encapsulate task
Rename variables to be less ambiguous
Make ToDo list use Task class
Remove generic from ToDo
commitResults.messageBody: Remove type parameter from ToDo class

commitResults.messageTitle: Add completeTask method
commitResults.messageBody: Marks task in ToDo list as complete

commitResults.messageTitle: Add done command to Kermit bot
commitResults.messageBody: Mark items in todo list as complete using "done" command. This is reflected in the "list" method as well

commitResults.messageTitle: Add speech when Kermit prints list
Change logic to use StringBuilder class
commitResults.messageBody: StringBuilder object used to construct strings when reading the input commands issued by user

commitResults.messageTitle: Add todos task to Kermit
commitResults.messageBody:
todos encapsulates simple tasks that only have a description and can be completed.
To prepare for more complex tasks such as deadline and event

commitResults.messageTitle: Change Kermit control flow to use switch statement
commitResults.messageBody: Return is used in "bye" case as break would exit out of the switch structure. Return is needed to exit the while loop and stop the program

commitResults.messageTitle: Line wrapped speech statement
Add deadline task
commitResults.messageBody: Deadline is a task that has a deadline

commitResults.messageTitle: Add deadline command to Kermit bot
Add Event task class
Change deadline string
commitResults.messageBody: Deadline toString() returns a prefix "[D]" instead of an "[E]" which represented an event task

commitResults.messageTitle: Add helper function to create message when task is added
commitResults.messageBody:
Helper function creates message to be used

String message was too long and was repeated 3 times in the code. Helper function used to reduce code re-use

commitResults.messageTitle: Amend missing spaces in Kermit speech
Add expected and input test for semi-automated test
Change script file reference class
commitResults.messageBody:
Script redirects input to bin/Kermit instead of bin/Duke

Script was referring to the original name of the iP bot Duke. Running this version would cause no output to be redirected to the file ACTUAL.txt for testing, causing the test to fail.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change invalid command text
Add KermitException for Kermit bot errors
commitResults.messageBody: KermitException should be used for any errors that occur during the runtime of Kermit Bot

commitResults.messageTitle: Throw KermitException for invalid command
commitResults.messageBody:
Invalid command text throws KermitException

An invalid command should raise an exception instead of being handled in the switch statement as an expected behaviour and just being printed out.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error checking to Kermit
commitResults.messageBody: Handle empty description for events and invalid flag arguments

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases to test exceptions
Make error thrown for missing flag argument Event clearer
Extend horizontal divider for styling
Add string at start of every error
commitResults.messageBody: Add string that will be printed before every error message, to add flavour to every error message. Make it consistent so that it is recognisable,

commitResults.messageTitle: Check validity of command outside switch statement
Move error checking logic out of switch statement
commitResults.messageBody:
Error checking is done as description and flag are constructed to reduce code repetition.

Ensures that inputs are valid before executing command logic

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test case for delete command
removeTask: return task
Add delete command (no error checking)
